text: Don't miss the critical detail here: A FIRST GRADE CLASSROOM.
author: standupkid

text: Also, she's totally blowing the ice cream for breakfast photo ops
author: standupkid

text: How long until our president isn't a sad little man who calls people names to hide his empty soul and massive insecurity?
author: standupkid

text: Ten years ago today, @mrsstandupkid and I were married in an apple orchard at the @carnerosresort in Napa. It was the first day of Spring, and it was the beginning of a beautiful life. I love you, Tiffanie. Happy Anniversary!
author: standupkid

text: Okay, that's it. I agree with @mrsstandupkid. We've got to break our only-send-cash-to-women-for-2020 rule to throw Mayor Pete a donation.
author: standupkid

text: Fantastic! Thanks!!
author: standupkid

text: @LorenaFdelaC Will the session with @NIMHDirector be posted online, by chance? (or any of the other lectures?) Thanks and hello from a crazy brain in the US!
author: standupkid

text: Looks like a beautiful venue... break a leg, @NIMHDirector!
author: standupkid

text: Thanks, Lily!!
author: standupkid

text: Saw this and my first thought was GUNNERSAURUS OH NO! #Arsenal
author: standupkid

text: Half the battle for me when faced with these constant fears is sometimes just to decide not to rush down the rabbit hole of evaluating them/processing them/figuring out how best to deal with them. I'm going to have to overthink this later... #OCDTalkHour
author: standupkid

text: I get overwhelmed constantly... but rarely ask for reassurance. I fear doing so will lead people to see me as a person who needs extra help, and for better or worse, I hate that and avoid it. #OCDTalkHour
author: standupkid

text: My experience with reassurance almost always involves a feeling of great warmth and happiness at someone expressing support--followed by wild screaming in my brain not to believe a word of it. #OCDTalkHour
author: standupkid

text: Hi everyone. Glad to have caught the chat, and always happy to connect with fellow travelers in this shitshow that is #OCD. Mine's always looking for new ways to harass me (I've started scratching my head, which is great fun), but I feel fortunate that my illness is moderate.
author: standupkid

text: Now there's an export we can feel shitty about.
author: standupkid

text: Nothing makes me prouder than seeing my daughter with her head in a book. I credit my always-reading Mom for modeling a love of reading that I see in my daughter every day. #FindingTheirStory
author: standupkid

text: Heads up, #OCD Tribe:
author: standupkid

text: Bercow is an absolute GIANT. He handles this so well... and, as an aside, he *really* makes me want to meet him, hang out, and have him call me a "cheeky chappy" sometime.
author: standupkid

text: "He is a terrorist. He is a criminal. He is an extremist." New Zealand PM @jacindaardern, again, in a refreshing break from American politicians, avoids lumping in stigmatizing words like "lunatic" or "deranged" while discussing mosque attack shooter. Words matter. Leaders lead.
author: standupkid

text: Donna Brazile makes her Fox News debut this hour, but insiders say she will not be anywhere near the network's debate debates or town halls heading into 2020: https://www.forbes.com/sites/markjoyella/2019/03/18/donna-brazile-joins-fox-news-i-know-im-going-to-get-criticized-from-my-friends/#31abfb515542 … @Forbes @ForbesEnt
author: standupkid

text: In New Zealand, the conversation around mental health isn't blame, but ensuring that Kiwis in need get the care they need, especially children. America can learn from NZ.
author: standupkid

text: Seems so simple, yet it's beyond the capacity of many people's brains to see it this way.
author: standupkid

text: And this senator responding to an egg on his head by hitting a kid? Why are so many politicians so deeply spineless and awful?
author: standupkid
